alert.note: Alert for Colorado; Jackson; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:19AM CDT until May 16 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Sandy Creek near Cordele affecting Colorado, Wharton and Jackson Counties. For the Sandy Creek...including Cordele...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandy Creek near Cordele. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with the creek close to 200 yards wide at FM 710 in the vicinity of the gage. Secondary roads are cut off and bridges near the creek flood and are dangerous. Livestock are cut off and potentially drowned. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 07/06/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Sandy Creek Cordele 18.0 16.5 Sun 7 am CDT 18.6 16.8 13.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.
